fieldalignmentä»‹ç»

$Â fieldalignment
fieldalignment:Â findÂ structsÂ thatÂ wouldÂ useÂ lessÂ memoryÂ ifÂ theirÂ fieldsÂ wereÂ sorted

Usage:Â fieldalignmentÂ [-flag]Â [package]

ThisÂ analyzerÂ findÂ structsÂ thatÂ canÂ beÂ rearrangedÂ toÂ useÂ lessÂ memory,Â andÂ provides
aÂ suggestedÂ editÂ withÂ theÂ mostÂ compactÂ order.

NoteÂ thatÂ thereÂ areÂ twoÂ differentÂ diagnosticsÂ reported.Â OneÂ checksÂ structÂ size,
andÂ theÂ otherÂ reportsÂ "pointerÂ bytes"Â used.Â PointerÂ bytesÂ isÂ howÂ manyÂ bytesÂ ofÂ the
objectÂ thatÂ theÂ garbageÂ collectorÂ hasÂ toÂ potentiallyÂ scanÂ forÂ pointers,Â forÂ example:

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â structÂ {Â uint32;Â stringÂ }

haveÂ 16Â pointerÂ bytesÂ becauseÂ theÂ garbageÂ collectorÂ hasÂ toÂ scanÂ upÂ throughÂ theÂ string's
innerÂ pointer.

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â structÂ {Â string;Â *uint32Â }

hasÂ 24Â pointerÂ bytesÂ becauseÂ itÂ hasÂ toÂ scanÂ furtherÂ throughÂ theÂ *uint32.

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â structÂ {Â string;Â uint32Â }

hasÂ 8Â becauseÂ itÂ canÂ stopÂ immediatelyÂ afterÂ theÂ stringÂ pointer.

BeÂ awareÂ thatÂ theÂ mostÂ compactÂ orderÂ isÂ notÂ alwaysÂ theÂ mostÂ efficient.
InÂ rareÂ casesÂ itÂ mayÂ causeÂ twoÂ variablesÂ eachÂ updatedÂ byÂ itsÂ ownÂ goroutine
toÂ occupyÂ theÂ sameÂ CPUÂ cacheÂ line,Â inducingÂ aÂ formÂ ofÂ memoryÂ contention
knownÂ asÂ "falseÂ sharing"Â thatÂ slowsÂ downÂ bothÂ goroutines.
